title: MenuInstSchema
description: Metadata required to create menu items across operating systems with `menuinst`.

$schema.title: $Schema
$schema.description: Standard of the JSON schema we adhere to.
$schema.markdownDescription: Standard of the JSON schema we adhere to.

menu_name.title: Menu Name
menu_name.description: Name for the category containing the items specified in `menu_items`.
menu_name.markdownDescription: Name for the category containing the items specified in `menu_items`.

menu_items.title: Menu Items
menu_items.description: List of menu entries to create across main desktop systems.
menu_items.markdownDescription: List of menu entries to create across main desktop systems.

markdownDescription: Metadata required to create menu items across operating systems with `menuinst`.

MenuItemNameDict.title: MenuItemNameDict
MenuItemNameDict.description: Variable menu item name. Use this dictionary if the menu item name depends on installation parameters such as the target environment.

target_environment_is_base.title: Target Environment Is Base
target_environment_is_base.description: Name when target environment is the base environment.
target_environment_is_base.markdownDescription: Name when target environment is the base environment.

target_environment_is_not_base.title: Target Environment Is Not Base
target_environment_is_not_base.description: Name when target environment is not the base environment.
target_environment_is_not_base.markdownDescription: Name when target environment is not the base environment.

MenuItemNameDict.markdownDescription: Variable menu item name. Use this dictionary if the menu item name depends on installation parameters such as the target environment.

Linux.title: Linux
Linux.description:
Linux-specific instructions.

Check the [Desktop entry specification]( https://specifications.freedesktop.org/desktop-entry-spec/latest/recognized-keys.html) for more details.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the menu item. Can be a dictionary if the name depends on installation parameters. See `MenuItemNameDict` for details.
name.markdownDescription: The name of the menu item. Can be a dictionary if the name depends on installation parameters. See `MenuItemNameDict` for details.

description.title: Description
description.description: A longer description of the menu item. Shown on popup messages.
description.markdownDescription: A longer description of the menu item. Shown on popup messages.

icon.title: Icon
icon.description: Path to the file representing or containing the icon.
icon.markdownDescription: Path to the file representing or containing the icon.

command.title: Command
command.description: Command to run with the menu item, expressed as a list of strings where each string is an argument.
command.markdownDescription: Command to run with the menu item, expressed as a list of strings where each string is an argument.

working_dir.title: Working Dir
working_dir.description: Working directory for the running process. Defaults to user directory on each platform.
working_dir.markdownDescription: Working directory for the running process. Defaults to user directory on each platform.

precommand.title: Precommand
precommand.description: (Simple, preferrably single-line) logic to run before the command is run. Runs before the environment is activated, if that applies.
precommand.markdownDescription: (Simple, preferrably single-line) logic to run before the command is run. Runs before the environment is activated, if that applies.

precreate.title: Precreate
precreate.description: (Simple, preferrably single-line) logic to run before the shortcut is created.
precreate.markdownDescription: (Simple, preferrably single-line) logic to run before the shortcut is created.

activate.title: Activate
activate.description: Whether to activate the target environment before running `command`.
activate.markdownDescription: Whether to activate the target environment before running `command`.

terminal.title: Terminal
terminal.description: Whether run the program in a terminal/console or not. On Windows, it only has an effect if `activate` is true. On MacOS, the application will ignore command-line arguments.
terminal.markdownDescription: Whether run the program in a terminal/console or not. On Windows, it only has an effect if `activate` is true. On MacOS, the application will ignore command-line arguments.

Categories.title: Categories
Categories.description: Categories in which the entry should be shown in a menu. See 'Registered categories' in the [Menu Spec]( http://www.freedesktop.org/Standards/menu-spec).
Categories.markdownDescription: Categories in which the entry should be shown in a menu. See 'Registered categories' in the [Menu Spec]( http://www.freedesktop.org/Standards/menu-spec).

DBusActivatable.title: Dbusactivatable
DBusActivatable.description: A boolean value specifying if D-Bus activation is supported for this application.
DBusActivatable.markdownDescription: A boolean value specifying if D-Bus activation is supported for this application.

GenericName.title: Genericname
GenericName.description: Generic name of the application; e.g. if the name is 'conda', this would be 'Package Manager'.
GenericName.markdownDescription: Generic name of the application; e.g. if the name is 'conda', this would be 'Package Manager'.

Hidden.title: Hidden
Hidden.description: Disable shortcut, signaling a missing resource.
Hidden.markdownDescription: Disable shortcut, signaling a missing resource.

Implements.title: Implements
Implements.description: List of supported interfaces. See 'Interfaces' in [Desktop Entry Spec]( https://specifications.freedesktop.org/desktop-entry-spec/latest/interfaces.html).
Implements.markdownDescription: List of supported interfaces. See 'Interfaces' in [Desktop Entry Spec]( https://specifications.freedesktop.org/desktop-entry-spec/latest/interfaces.html).

Keywords.title: Keywords
Keywords.description: Additional terms to describe this shortcut to aid in searching.
Keywords.markdownDescription: Additional terms to describe this shortcut to aid in searching.

MimeType.title: Mimetype
MimeType.description: The MIME type(s) supported by this application. Note this includes file types and URL protocols. For URL protocols, use `x-scheme-handler/your-protocol-here`. For example, if you want to register `menuinst:`, you would include `x-scheme-handler/menuinst`.
MimeType.markdownDescription: The MIME type(s) supported by this application. Note this includes file types and URL protocols. For URL protocols, use `x-scheme-handler/your-protocol-here`. For example, if you want to register `menuinst:`, you would include `x-scheme-handler/menuinst`.

NoDisplay.title: Nodisplay
NoDisplay.description: Do not show this item in the menu. Useful to associate MIME types and other registrations, without having an actual clickable item. Not to be confused with 'Hidden'.
NoDisplay.markdownDescription: Do not show this item in the menu. Useful to associate MIME types and other registrations, without having an actual clickable item. Not to be confused with 'Hidden'.

NotShowIn.title: Notshowin
NotShowIn.description: Desktop environments that should NOT display this item. It'll check against `$XDG_CURRENT_DESKTOP`.
NotShowIn.markdownDescription: Desktop environments that should NOT display this item. It'll check against `$XDG_CURRENT_DESKTOP`.

OnlyShowIn.title: Onlyshowin
OnlyShowIn.description: Desktop environments that should display this item. It'll check against `$XDG_CURRENT_DESKTOP`.
OnlyShowIn.markdownDescription: Desktop environments that should display this item. It'll check against `$XDG_CURRENT_DESKTOP`.

PrefersNonDefaultGPU.title: Prefersnondefaultgpu
PrefersNonDefaultGPU.description: Hint that the app prefers to be run on a more powerful discrete GPU if available.
PrefersNonDefaultGPU.markdownDescription: Hint that the app prefers to be run on a more powerful discrete GPU if available.

SingleMainWindow.title: Singlemainwindow
SingleMainWindow.description: Do not show the 'New Window' option in the app's context menu.
SingleMainWindow.markdownDescription: Do not show the 'New Window' option in the app's context menu.

TryExec.title: Tryexec
TryExec.description: Filename or absolute path to an executable file on disk used to determine if the program is actually installed and can be run. If the test fails, the shortcut might be ignored / hidden.
TryExec.markdownDescription: Filename or absolute path to an executable file on disk used to determine if the program is actually installed and can be run. If the test fails, the shortcut might be ignored / hidden.

glob_patterns.title: Glob Patterns
glob_patterns.description: Map of custom MIME types to their corresponding glob patterns (e.g. `*.txt`). Only needed if you define custom MIME types in `MimeType`.
glob_patterns.markdownDescription: Map of custom MIME types to their corresponding glob patterns (e.g. `*.txt`). Only needed if you define custom MIME types in `MimeType`.

Linux.markdownDescription:
Linux-specific instructions.

Check the [Desktop entry specification]( https://specifications.freedesktop.org/desktop-entry-spec/latest/recognized-keys.html) for more details.

CFBundleURLTypesModel.title: CFBundleURLTypesModel
CFBundleURLTypesModel.description: Describes a URL scheme associated with the app.

CFBundleTypeRole.title: Cfbundletyperole
CFBundleTypeRole.description: This key specifies the app's role with respect to the URL.
CFBundleTypeRole.markdownDescription: This key specifies the app's role with respect to the URL.

CFBundleURLSchemes.title: Cfbundleurlschemes
CFBundleURLSchemes.description: URL schemes / protocols handled by this type (e.g. 'mailto').
CFBundleURLSchemes.markdownDescription: URL schemes / protocols handled by this type (e.g. 'mailto').

CFBundleURLName.title: Cfbundleurlname
CFBundleURLName.description: Abstract name for this URL type. Uniqueness recommended.
CFBundleURLName.markdownDescription: Abstract name for this URL type. Uniqueness recommended.

CFBundleURLIconFile.title: Cfbundleurliconfile
CFBundleURLIconFile.description: Name of the icon image file (minus the .icns extension).
CFBundleURLIconFile.markdownDescription: Name of the icon image file (minus the .icns extension).

CFBundleURLTypesModel.markdownDescription: Describes a URL scheme associated with the app.

CFBundleDocumentTypesModel.title: CFBundleDocumentTypesModel
CFBundleDocumentTypesModel.description: Describes a document type associated with the app.

CFBundleTypeIconFile.title: Cfbundletypeiconfile
CFBundleTypeIconFile.description: Name of the icon image file (minus the .icns extension).
CFBundleTypeIconFile.markdownDescription: Name of the icon image file (minus the .icns extension).

CFBundleTypeName.title: Cfbundletypename
CFBundleTypeName.description: Abstract name for this document type. Uniqueness recommended.
CFBundleTypeName.markdownDescription: Abstract name for this document type. Uniqueness recommended.

CFBundleTypeRole.title: Cfbundletyperole
CFBundleTypeRole.description: This key specifies the app's role with respect to the type.
CFBundleTypeRole.markdownDescription: This key specifies the app's role with respect to the type.

LSItemContentTypes.title: Lsitemcontenttypes
LSItemContentTypes.description:
List of UTI strings defining a supported file type; e.g. for PNG files, use 'public.png'. See [UTI Reference]( https://developer.apple.com/library/archive/documentation/Miscellaneous/Reference/UTIRef/Articles/System-DeclaredUniformTypeIdentifiers.html) for more info about the system-defined UTIs. Custom UTIs can be defined via 'UTExportedTypeDeclarations'. UTIs defined by other apps (not the system) need to be imported via 'UTImportedTypeDeclarations'.

See [Fun with UTIs](https://www.cocoanetics.com/2012/09/fun-with-uti/) for more info.
LSItemContentTypes.markdownDescription:
List of UTI strings defining a supported file type; e.g. for PNG files, use 'public.png'. See [UTI Reference]( https://developer.apple.com/library/archive/documentation/Miscellaneous/Reference/UTIRef/Articles/System-DeclaredUniformTypeIdentifiers.html) for more info about the system-defined UTIs. Custom UTIs can be defined via 'UTExportedTypeDeclarations'. UTIs defined by other apps (not the system) need to be imported via 'UTImportedTypeDeclarations'.

See [Fun with UTIs](https://www.cocoanetics.com/2012/09/fun-with-uti/) for more info.

LSHandlerRank.title: Lshandlerrank
LSHandlerRank.description: Determines how Launch Services ranks this app among the apps that declare themselves editors or viewers of files of this type.
LSHandlerRank.markdownDescription: Determines how Launch Services ranks this app among the apps that declare themselves editors or viewers of files of this type.

CFBundleDocumentTypesModel.markdownDescription: Describes a document type associated with the app.

UTTypeConformsTo.title: Uttypeconformsto
UTTypeConformsTo.description: The Uniform Type Identifier types that this type conforms to.
UTTypeConformsTo.markdownDescription: The Uniform Type Identifier types that this type conforms to.

UTTypeIconFile.title: Uttypeiconfile
UTTypeIconFile.description: The bundle icon resource to associate with this type.
UTTypeIconFile.markdownDescription: The bundle icon resource to associate with this type.

UTTypeIdentifier.title: Uttypeidentifier
UTTypeIdentifier.description: The Uniform Type Identifier to assign to this type.
UTTypeIdentifier.markdownDescription: The Uniform Type Identifier to assign to this type.

UTTypeReferenceURL.title: Uttypereferenceurl
UTTypeReferenceURL.description: The webpage for a reference document that describes this type.
UTTypeReferenceURL.markdownDescription: The webpage for a reference document that describes this type.

UTTypeTagSpecification.title: Uttypetagspecification
UTTypeTagSpecification.description: A dictionary defining one or more equivalent type identifiers.
UTTypeTagSpecification.markdownDescription: A dictionary defining one or more equivalent type identifiers.

MacOS.title: MacOS
MacOS.description:
Mac-specific instructions. Check these URLs for more info:

- `CF*` keys: see [Core Foundation Keys](https://developer.apple.com/library/archive/documentation/General/Reference/InfoPlistKeyReference/Articles/CoreFoundationKeys.html) - `LS*` keys: see [Launch Services Keys](https://developer.apple.com/library/archive/documentation/General/Reference/InfoPlistKeyReference/Articles/LaunchServicesKeys.html) - `entitlements`: see [Entitlements documentation](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/bundleresources/entitlements)

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the menu item. Can be a dictionary if the name depends on installation parameters. See `MenuItemNameDict` for details.
name.markdownDescription: The name of the menu item. Can be a dictionary if the name depends on installation parameters. See `MenuItemNameDict` for details.

description.title: Description
description.description: A longer description of the menu item. Shown on popup messages.
description.markdownDescription: A longer description of the menu item. Shown on popup messages.

icon.title: Icon
icon.description: Path to the file representing or containing the icon.
icon.markdownDescription: Path to the file representing or containing the icon.

command.title: Command
command.description: Command to run with the menu item, expressed as a list of strings where each string is an argument.
command.markdownDescription: Command to run with the menu item, expressed as a list of strings where each string is an argument.

working_dir.title: Working Dir
working_dir.description: Working directory for the running process. Defaults to user directory on each platform.
working_dir.markdownDescription: Working directory for the running process. Defaults to user directory on each platform.

precommand.title: Precommand
precommand.description: (Simple, preferrably single-line) logic to run before the command is run. Runs before the environment is activated, if that applies.
precommand.markdownDescription: (Simple, preferrably single-line) logic to run before the command is run. Runs before the environment is activated, if that applies.

precreate.title: Precreate
precreate.description: (Simple, preferrably single-line) logic to run before the shortcut is created.
precreate.markdownDescription: (Simple, preferrably single-line) logic to run before the shortcut is created.

activate.title: Activate
activate.description: Whether to activate the target environment before running `command`.
activate.markdownDescription: Whether to activate the target environment before running `command`.

terminal.title: Terminal
terminal.description: Whether run the program in a terminal/console or not. On Windows, it only has an effect if `activate` is true. On MacOS, the application will ignore command-line arguments.
terminal.markdownDescription: Whether run the program in a terminal/console or not. On Windows, it only has an effect if `activate` is true. On MacOS, the application will ignore command-line arguments.

CFBundleDisplayName.title: Cfbundledisplayname
CFBundleDisplayName.description: Display name of the bundle, visible to users and used by Siri. If not provided, 'menuinst' will use the 'name' field.
CFBundleDisplayName.markdownDescription: Display name of the bundle, visible to users and used by Siri. If not provided, 'menuinst' will use the 'name' field.

CFBundleIdentifier.title: Cfbundleidentifier
CFBundleIdentifier.description: Unique identifier for the shortcut. Typically uses a reverse-DNS format. If not provided, 'menuinst' will generate one from the 'name' field.
CFBundleIdentifier.markdownDescription: Unique identifier for the shortcut. Typically uses a reverse-DNS format. If not provided, 'menuinst' will generate one from the 'name' field.

CFBundleName.title: Cfbundlename
CFBundleName.description: Short name of the bundle. May be used if `CFBundleDisplayName` is absent. If not provided, 'menuinst' will generate one from the 'name' field.
CFBundleName.markdownDescription: Short name of the bundle. May be used if `CFBundleDisplayName` is absent. If not provided, 'menuinst' will generate one from the 'name' field.

CFBundleSpokenName.title: Cfbundlespokenname
CFBundleSpokenName.description: Suitable replacement for text-to-speech operations on the app. For example, 'my app one two three' instead of 'MyApp123'.
CFBundleSpokenName.markdownDescription: Suitable replacement for text-to-speech operations on the app. For example, 'my app one two three' instead of 'MyApp123'.

CFBundleVersion.title: Cfbundleversion
CFBundleVersion.description: Build version number for the bundle. In the context of 'menuinst' this can be used to signal a new version of the menu item for the same application version.
CFBundleVersion.markdownDescription: Build version number for the bundle. In the context of 'menuinst' this can be used to signal a new version of the menu item for the same application version.

CFBundleURLTypes.title: Cfbundleurltypes
CFBundleURLTypes.description: URL types supported by this app. Requires setting `event_handler` too. Note this feature requires macOS 10.14.4 or above.
CFBundleURLTypes.markdownDescription: URL types supported by this app. Requires setting `event_handler` too. Note this feature requires macOS 10.14.4 or above.

CFBundleDocumentTypes.title: Cfbundledocumenttypes
CFBundleDocumentTypes.description: Document types supported by this app. Requires setting `event_handler` too. Requires macOS 10.14.4 or above.
CFBundleDocumentTypes.markdownDescription: Document types supported by this app. Requires setting `event_handler` too. Requires macOS 10.14.4 or above.

LSApplicationCategoryType.title: Lsapplicationcategorytype
LSApplicationCategoryType.description: The App Store uses this string to determine the appropriate categorization.
LSApplicationCategoryType.markdownDescription: The App Store uses this string to determine the appropriate categorization.

LSBackgroundOnly.title: Lsbackgroundonly
LSBackgroundOnly.description: Specifies whether this app runs only in the background.
LSBackgroundOnly.markdownDescription: Specifies whether this app runs only in the background.

LSEnvironment.title: Lsenvironment
LSEnvironment.description: List of key-value pairs used to define environment variables.
LSEnvironment.markdownDescription: List of key-value pairs used to define environment variables.

LSMinimumSystemVersion.title: Lsminimumsystemversion
LSMinimumSystemVersion.description: Minimum version of macOS required for this app to run, as `x.y.z`. For example, for macOS v10.4 and later, use `10.4.0`.
LSMinimumSystemVersion.markdownDescription: Minimum version of macOS required for this app to run, as `x.y.z`. For example, for macOS v10.4 and later, use `10.4.0`.

LSMultipleInstancesProhibited.title: Lsmultipleinstancesprohibited
LSMultipleInstancesProhibited.description: Whether an app is prohibited from running simultaneously in multiple user sessions.
LSMultipleInstancesProhibited.markdownDescription: Whether an app is prohibited from running simultaneously in multiple user sessions.

LSRequiresNativeExecution.title: Lsrequiresnativeexecution
LSRequiresNativeExecution.description: If true, prevent a universal binary from being run under Rosetta emulation on an Intel-based Mac.
LSRequiresNativeExecution.markdownDescription: If true, prevent a universal binary from being run under Rosetta emulation on an Intel-based Mac.

NSSupportsAutomaticGraphicsSwitching.title: Nssupportsautomaticgraphicsswitching
NSSupportsAutomaticGraphicsSwitching.description: If true, allows an OpenGL app to utilize the integrated GPU.
NSSupportsAutomaticGraphicsSwitching.markdownDescription: If true, allows an OpenGL app to utilize the integrated GPU.

UTExportedTypeDeclarations.title: Utexportedtypedeclarations
UTExportedTypeDeclarations.description: The uniform type identifiers owned and exported by the app.
UTExportedTypeDeclarations.markdownDescription: The uniform type identifiers owned and exported by the app.

UTImportedTypeDeclarations.title: Utimportedtypedeclarations
UTImportedTypeDeclarations.description: The uniform type identifiers inherently supported, but not owned, by the app.
UTImportedTypeDeclarations.markdownDescription: The uniform type identifiers inherently supported, but not owned, by the app.

entitlements.title: Entitlements
entitlements.description: List of permissions to request for the launched application. See [the entitlements docs]( https://developer.apple.com/documentation/bundleresources/entitlements) for a full list of possible values.
entitlements.markdownDescription: List of permissions to request for the launched application. See [the entitlements docs]( https://developer.apple.com/documentation/bundleresources/entitlements) for a full list of possible values.

link_in_bundle.title: Link In Bundle
link_in_bundle.description: Paths that should be symlinked into the shortcut app bundle. It takes a mapping of source to destination paths. Destination paths must be relative. Placeholder `{{ MENU_ITEM_LOCATION }}` can be useful.
link_in_bundle.markdownDescription: Paths that should be symlinked into the shortcut app bundle. It takes a mapping of source to destination paths. Destination paths must be relative. Placeholder `{{ MENU_ITEM_LOCATION }}` can be useful.

event_handler.title: Event Handler
event_handler.description: Required shell script logic to handle opened URL payloads. Note this feature requires macOS 10.14.4 or above.
event_handler.markdownDescription: Required shell script logic to handle opened URL payloads. Note this feature requires macOS 10.14.4 or above.

MacOS.markdownDescription:
Mac-specific instructions. Check these URLs for more info:

- `CF*` keys: see [Core Foundation Keys](https://developer.apple.com/library/archive/documentation/General/Reference/InfoPlistKeyReference/Articles/CoreFoundationKeys.html) - `LS*` keys: see [Launch Services Keys](https://developer.apple.com/library/archive/documentation/General/Reference/InfoPlistKeyReference/Articles/LaunchServicesKeys.html) - `entitlements`: see [Entitlements documentation](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/bundleresources/entitlements)

Windows.title: Windows
Windows.description: Windows-specific instructions. You can override global keys here if needed

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the menu item. Can be a dictionary if the name depends on installation parameters. See `MenuItemNameDict` for details.
name.markdownDescription: The name of the menu item. Can be a dictionary if the name depends on installation parameters. See `MenuItemNameDict` for details.

description.title: Description
description.description: A longer description of the menu item. Shown on popup messages.
description.markdownDescription: A longer description of the menu item. Shown on popup messages.

icon.title: Icon
icon.description: Path to the file representing or containing the icon.
icon.markdownDescription: Path to the file representing or containing the icon.

command.title: Command
command.description: Command to run with the menu item, expressed as a list of strings where each string is an argument.
command.markdownDescription: Command to run with the menu item, expressed as a list of strings where each string is an argument.

working_dir.title: Working Dir
working_dir.description: Working directory for the running process. Defaults to user directory on each platform.
working_dir.markdownDescription: Working directory for the running process. Defaults to user directory on each platform.

precommand.title: Precommand
precommand.description: (Simple, preferrably single-line) logic to run before the command is run. Runs before the environment is activated, if that applies.
precommand.markdownDescription: (Simple, preferrably single-line) logic to run before the command is run. Runs before the environment is activated, if that applies.

precreate.description: (Simple, preferrably single-line) logic to run before the shortcut is created.
precreate.markdownDescription: (Simple, preferrably single-line) logic to run before the shortcut is created.

activate.title: Activate
activate.description: Whether to activate the target environment before running `command`.
activate.markdownDescription: Whether to activate the target environment before running `command`.

terminal.title: Terminal
terminal.description: Whether run the program in a terminal/console or not. On Windows, it only has an effect if `activate` is true. On MacOS, the application will ignore command-line arguments.
terminal.markdownDescription: Whether run the program in a terminal/console or not. On Windows, it only has an effect if `activate` is true. On MacOS, the application will ignore command-line arguments.

desktop.title: Desktop
desktop.description: Whether to create a desktop icon in addition to the Start Menu item.
desktop.markdownDescription: Whether to create a desktop icon in addition to the Start Menu item.

quicklaunch.title: Quicklaunch
quicklaunch.description: DEPRECATED. Whether to create a quick launch icon in addition to the Start Menu item.
quicklaunch.markdownDescription: DEPRECATED. Whether to create a quick launch icon in addition to the Start Menu item.

terminal_profile.title: Terminal Profile
terminal_profile.description: Name of the Windows Terminal profile to create. This name must be unique across multiple installations because menuinst will overwrite Terminal profiles with the same name.
terminal_profile.markdownDescription: Name of the Windows Terminal profile to create. This name must be unique across multiple installations because menuinst will overwrite Terminal profiles with the same name.

url_protocols.title: Url Protocols
url_protocols.description: URL protocols that will be associated with this program.
url_protocols.markdownDescription: URL protocols that will be associated with this program.

file_extensions.title: File Extensions
file_extensions.description: File extensions that will be associated with this program.
file_extensions.markdownDescription: File extensions that will be associated with this program.

app_user_model_id.title: App User Model Id
app_user_model_id.description:
Identifier used in Windows 7 and above to associate processes, files and windows with a particular application. If your shortcut produces duplicated icons, you need to define this field. If not set, it will default to `Menuinst.<name>`.

See [AppUserModelID docs]( https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/shell/appids#how-to-form-an-application-defined-appusermodelid) for more information on the required string format.
app_user_model_id.markdownDescription:
Identifier used in Windows 7 and above to associate processes, files and windows with a particular application. If your shortcut produces duplicated icons, you need to define this field. If not set, it will default to `Menuinst.<name>`.

See [AppUserModelID docs]( https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/shell/appids#how-to-form-an-application-defined-appusermodelid) for more information on the required string format.

Windows.markdownDescription: Windows-specific instructions. You can override global keys here if needed

Platforms.title: Platforms
Platforms.description:
Platform specific options.

Note each of these fields supports the same keys as the top-level `MenuItem` (sans `platforms` itself), in case overrides are needed.

linux.title: Linux
linux.description: Options for Linux. See `Linux` model for details.
linux.markdownDescription: Options for Linux. See `Linux` model for details.

osx.title: Osx
osx.description: Options for macOS. See `MacOS` model for details.
osx.markdownDescription: Options for macOS. See `MacOS` model for details.

win.title: Win
win.description: Options for Windows. See `Windows` model for details.
win.markdownDescription: Options for Windows. See `Windows` model for details.

MenuItem.markdownDescription: Instructions to create a menu item across operating systems.
